page.title: 17INDUSTRIES II - HUTCHISONS
page.content: Hutchisons was founded in 1827 by Robert Hutchison, but the members of the Hutchison family had been trading in Kirkcaldy in the nineteenth century.The business was sold to Pauls & Whites Ltd. of Ipswich in 1972 and they in turn have been taken over by Harrisons & Crossfield in 1985. Ninety nine people are employed at Kirkcaldy in the two businesses of malting and flour milling. The flour mill uses 60,000 tonnes of wheat each year - 6,000 is imported from Canada and the remainder is home grown. The flour produced is sold to biscuit manufacturers and bakers throughout Scotland. The maltings process 40,000 tonnes of barley each year, all grown in east and central Scotland. The malt is sold mainly to distilleres and brewers in Scotland and north England although quite a lot is exported.
